intro: Sisymbrium latifolium, commonly known as wild radish, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant produces round, smooth pods that contain several seeds. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in North America. Sisymbrium latifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
